title: If I use a song on Tik Tok, it'll cut the song and video off at 15 seconds, I can go longer without an audio, how do I fix this? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tik Tok has a special license with music providers that only allows them to play a 15 second clip. They cannot legally allow more music than that or they are engaging in copyright infringement and their app will be sued into oblivion under a massive wave of lawsuits. Further, they really want to be about short videos. This is a boundary they are trying to hold you to: 15 second videos. They do let you go to a full 60 seconds, but not with music. The whole name implies videos that are only a few seconds like, “tik tok” is the sound of a stopwatch ticking. If you want to do something other than what they allow, you need to be posting on YouTube or Facebook or Vimeo or something; because Tik Tok doesn’t allow that.

Thank you for requesting my answer: I’m working on a TikTok page here: CHECK ME OUT on TIKTOK and I have made videos longer than 15 seconds with music. Before I tell you how to do it, TikTok favors shorter 15 second videos and so do viewers. It’s not about licencing as people suggested, TikTok is a China based company that doesn’t abide by the same copyright laws as other countries do. Here’s how to do a 60 second video with music for the entire video. Tap on the “+ sign”Select “60s”Tap “Sounds” in the top middleTap “My Sound” to select a track from your phones MP3 filesRecord your videoDon’t forget to check out my TikTok where I do motivational videos and answer questions there too.
